name: mischmetal production, primary | mischmetal | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2683/documentation

Production of Mischmetal from bastnaesite by wet chemical attack and fused salt electrolysis. The product contains 53% Ce, 21% La, 17% Nd, 6% Pr, 0.2% Sm, the rest consistin of Eu, Gd and others. The overall quality of the data is poor. It however may be used as alloying constituent in HSLA steels, nodular iron and hydrogen storage in metal hydride batteries (LaNi5).This dataset is not to be used when mischmetal is a substantial part of the system modelled ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Includes the basic raw materials consumed and energy for precipitation reaction, filtration and drying. No direct emissions or infrastructure are included.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset production facilities scattered over the world. Most upstream processes such as electricity demand and chemicals consumption are approximated with datasets for European situation.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Production from bastnaesite concentrate that is converted to its chloride and reduced with fused salt electrolysis. Electrolysis approximated with processes from aluminium industry.
